abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Industrial Credit Line project in Lao
            People's Democratic Republic. Specifically, the project
            objectives were: (a) to upgrade the capacity and
            productivity of small- and medium-sized industries through:
            the acquisition of modern equipment and essential spare
            parts and raw materials, and the provision of technical
            assistance to improve production methods and management
            skills; and (b) to initiate the development of a capability
            for project evaluation within SBL with a view towards
            progressively strengthening the institution's ability
            to assume its expanded financial intermediation function
            under the New Economic Mechanism (NEM). Bank's
            performance was not satisfactory. Borrower's
            performance was not satisfactory. The key lessons learned
            were as follows: (a) potential reforms and resulting changes
            in structure or methods of operations should be considered
            before embarking on the first project in a particular
            sector; (b) discontinuity of staff within an implementing
            agency is of concern in any project but is of particular
            concern in countries where human capacity is still weak; (c)
            adequate attention to and resources for supervision on the
            part of International Development Association (IDA),
            particularly for the first operation within a sector, is
            crucial to effective project implementation; and (d)
            technical assistance, when crucial to project
            implementation, should be included in project design and
            financed by the project.
